When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **left**.

When **dividing** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the **right**.

Each digit of $33$ is one place to the right of the same digit in the number $330$.

Number | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-:
$330$| $\purpleD3$ |$\searrow\blueD{3}$ | $\searrow\greenD{0}$  
$33$ | |$\greenD3$ | $\blueD3$

$\purpleD3\blueD3\greenD0 \div 10=\purpleD3\blueD3$ so,

$\purpleD3\blueD3\greenD0 \div \purpleD3\blueD3 = 10$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |
$330$ | | $\swarrow\purpleD{3}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{3}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{0}$  
$10 \times 330$ | $\purpleD{3}$ |$\blueD{3}$ |$\greenD0$ | $0$

$10 \times \purpleD3\blueD3\greenD0 =\purpleD3{,}\blueD3\greenD00$

When **multiplying** by $10$, we shift each digit $1$ place value to the left.

Number | Thousands | Hundreds | Tens | Ones
:-: | :-: | :-: | :-: | :-: |
$303$ | | $\swarrow\purpleD{3}$ | $\swarrow\blueD{0}$ | $\swarrow\greenD{3}$  
$303 \times 10$ | $\purpleD{3}$ |$\blueD{0}$ |$\greenD3$ | $0$

$\purpleD3\blueD0\greenD3 \times 10 =\purpleD3{,}\blueD0\greenD30$
